question: i went one week without eating?
question_content:
what do ya think of that?
(the only thing i drank was water)

answers.answer_content: did you lose a lot of weight?  Did you still have energy??

Based on the experiences of my brother, one week isn't harmful, and always provides some weight loss, if that's why you did it.  He used to fast for a week to ten days about once a year if he was gaining - said it was easier than dieting, you just don't eat, no decisions, no temptations, and you get a cleansing effect.  Don't know if that's true.  You probably know that a sensible diet is better, even if just trying to get a little trimmer.  Take care.

The rule is 3-3-3. Humans can go for 3 minutes without oxygen, 3 days without water, and 3 weeks without food. Most clensing diets recommend a water- or water-and-brown-rice fast of 2 weeks (3 is life-threatening).

I did that when I was a teenager, and I spiraled out of control, I would only eat once a day and would black out every morning in the shower, yes I was thin but I still felt and saw fat when I looked in the mirror.  I've learned how to diet the correct way as I grew older and now I like my body.
It's interesting. I've kind of always wanted to do that for cleansing purposes, but I've been too afraid that I'd gain too much weight after.
That is crazy. Do not attempt that again. Health is the foremost important thing in life.
